00078 /**************************************************************************/
00087 EMSTATUS PAL_SpiInit (void)
00088 {
00089   EMSTATUS                status    = PAL_EMSTATUS_OK;
00090   USART_InitSync_TypeDef  usartInit = USART_INITSYNC_DEFAULT;
00091 
00092   /* Initialize USART for SPI transaction */
00093   CMU_ClockEnable( PAL_SPI_USART_CLOCK, true );
00094   usartInit.baudrate = PAL_SPI_BAUDRATE;
00095 
00096   USART_InitSync( PAL_SPI_USART_UNIT, &usartInit );
00097 
00098 #if defined( USART_ROUTEPEN_TXPEN )
00099 
00100   PAL_SPI_USART_UNIT->ROUTEPEN = USART_ROUTEPEN_TXPEN
00101     | USART_ROUTEPEN_CLKPEN;
00102   PAL_SPI_USART_UNIT->ROUTELOC0 = ( PAL_SPI_USART_UNIT->ROUTELOC0 &
00103     ~( _USART_ROUTELOC0_TXLOC_MASK | _USART_ROUTELOC0_CLKLOC_MASK ) )
00104     | ( PAL_SPI_USART_LOCATION_TX  << _USART_ROUTELOC0_TXLOC_SHIFT  )
00105     | ( PAL_SPI_USART_LOCATION_SCLK  << _USART_ROUTELOC0_CLKLOC_SHIFT  );
00106 
00107 #else
00108 
00109   PAL_SPI_USART_UNIT->ROUTE = (USART_ROUTE_CLKPEN | USART_ROUTE_TXPEN | PAL_SPI_USART_LOCATION);
00110 
00111 #endif
00112 
00113   return status;
00114 }

00117 /**************************************************************************/
00125 EMSTATUS PAL_SpiShutdown (void)
00126 {
00127   EMSTATUS status = PAL_EMSTATUS_OK;
00128 
00129   /* Disable the USART device used for SPI. */
00130   USART_Enable( PAL_SPI_USART_UNIT, usartDisable);
00131 
00132   /* Disable the USART clock. */
00133   CMU_ClockEnable( PAL_SPI_USART_CLOCK, false );
00134 
00135   return status;
00136 }

00138 
00139 /**************************************************************************/
00147 EMSTATUS PAL_SpiTransmit (uint8_t* data, unsigned int len)
00148 {
00149   EMSTATUS status = PAL_EMSTATUS_OK;
00150 
00151   while (len>0)
00152   {
00153     /* Send only one byte if len==1 or data pointer is not aligned at a 16 bit
00154        word location in memory. */
00155     if ((len == 1) || ((unsigned int)data & 0x1))
00156     {
00157       USART_Tx( PAL_SPI_USART_UNIT, *(uint8_t*)data );
00158       len  --;
00159       data ++;
00160     }
00161     else
00162     {
00163       USART_TxDouble( PAL_SPI_USART_UNIT, *(uint16_t*)data );
00164       len  -= 2;
00165       data += 2;
00166     }
00167   }
00168 
00169   /* Wait for transfer to finish */
00170   while (!(PAL_SPI_USART_UNIT->STATUS & USART_STATUS_TXC)) ;
00171 
00172   return status;
00173 }

00194 /**************************************************************************/
00202 EMSTATUS PAL_TimerShutdown (void)
00203 {
00204   EMSTATUS status = PAL_EMSTATUS_OK;
00205 
00206   /* Nothing to do since the UDELAY_Delay does not use any resources after
00207      the UDELAY_Calibrate has been called. The UDELAY_Calibrate uses the
00208      RTC to calibrate the delay loop, and restores the RTC after use. */
00209 
00210   return status;
00211 }

00222 {
00223   EMSTATUS status = PAL_EMSTATUS_OK;
00224 
00225   UDELAY_Delay(usecs);
00226 
00227   return status;
00228 }

00243                             void* argument,
00244                             unsigned int frequency)
00245 {
00246   if (0 != PAL_TIMER_REPEAT_FUNCTION(pFunction, argument, frequency))
00247     return PAL_EMSTATUS_REPEAT_FAILED;
00248   else
00249     return EMSTATUS_OK;

00292 /***************************************************************************/
00311 EMSTATUS PAL_GpioPinModeSet(unsigned int   port,
00312                             unsigned int   pin,
00313                             PAL_GpioMode_t mode,
00314                             unsigned int   platformSpecific)
00315 {
00316   EMSTATUS status = PAL_EMSTATUS_OK;
00317   GPIO_Mode_TypeDef   emGpioMode;
00318 
00319   /* Convert PAL pin mode to GPIO_Mode_TypeDef defined in em_gpio.h.  */
00320   switch (mode)
00321   {
00322   case palGpioModePushPull:
00323     emGpioMode = gpioModePushPull;
00324     break;
00325   default:
00326     return PAL_EMSTATUS_INVALID_PARAM;
00327   }
00328 
00329   GPIO_PinModeSet((GPIO_Port_TypeDef) port, pin, emGpioMode, platformSpecific);
00330 
00331   return status;
00332 }

00409 
00410 #ifdef INCLUDE_PAL_GPIO_PIN_AUTO_TOGGLE
00411 /**************************************************************************/
00419 EMSTATUS PAL_GpioPinAutoToggle (unsigned int gpioPort,
00420                                 unsigned int gpioPin,
00421                                 unsigned int frequency)
00422 {
00423   EMSTATUS status = EMSTATUS_OK;
00424 
00425 #ifdef INCLUDE_PAL_GPIO_PIN_AUTO_TOGGLE_HW_ONLY
00426 
00427 #if defined( BSP_STK_2010 )
00428   /* We only support auto HW toggling on GPIO port E pin 10 on Zero STK.  */
00429   if ( (gpioPortE != gpioPort) || (10 != gpioPin) )
00430 
00431 #elif defined( BSP_STK_2011 )
00432   /* We only support auto HW toggling on GPIO port F pin 3 on Happy STK.  */
00433   if ( (gpioPortF != gpioPort) || (3 != gpioPin) )
00434 
00435 #elif defined( BSP_STK_2500 )
00436   /* We only support auto HW toggling on GPIO port D pin 13 on Pearl STK.  */
00437   if ( (gpioPortD != gpioPort) || (13 != gpioPin) )
00438 
00439 #else
00440 #error "Illegal display auto-toggle setup."
00441 #endif
00442   {
00443     status = PAL_EMSTATUS_INVALID_PARAM;
00444   }
00445   else
00446   {
00447     /* Setup PRS to drive the GPIO pin which is connected to the
00448        display com inversion pin (EXTCOMIN) using the RTC COMP0 signal or
00449        RTCC CCV1 signal as source. */
00450 #if defined(PAL_CLOCK_RTCC)
00451     uint32_t     source  = PRS_CH_CTRL_SOURCESEL_RTCC;
00452     uint32_t     signal  = PRS_CH_CTRL_SIGSEL_RTCCCCV1;
00453 #else
00454     uint32_t     source  = PRS_CH_CTRL_SOURCESEL_RTC;
00455     uint32_t     signal  = PRS_CH_CTRL_SIGSEL_RTCCOMP0;
00456 #endif
00457 
00458     /* Enable PRS clock */
00459     CMU_ClockEnable(cmuClock_PRS, true);
00460 
00461     /* Set up PRS to trigger from an RTC compare match */
00462     PRS_SourceAsyncSignalSet(LCD_AUTO_TOGGLE_PRS_CH, source, signal);
00463 
00464     /* This outputs the PRS pulse on the EXTCOMIN pin */
00465 #if defined(_SILICON_LABS_32B_PLATFORM_2)
00466     LCD_AUTO_TOGGLE_PRS_ROUTELOC();
00467     PRS->ROUTEPEN |= LCD_AUTO_TOGGLE_PRS_ROUTEPEN;
00468 #else
00469     PRS->ROUTE = ( PRS->ROUTE & ~_PRS_ROUTE_LOCATION_MASK )
00470                  | LCD_AUTO_TOGGLE_PRS_ROUTE_LOC;
00471     PRS->ROUTE |= LCD_AUTO_TOGGLE_PRS_ROUTE_PEN;
00472 #endif
00473   }
00474 #else
00475   /* Store GPIO pin data. */
00476   gpioPortNo = gpioPort;
00477   gpioPinNo  = gpioPin;
00478 #endif
00479 
00480   if (EMSTATUS_OK == status)
00481   {
00482     /* Setup GPIO pin. */
00483     GPIO_PinModeSet((GPIO_Port_TypeDef)gpioPort, gpioPin, gpioModePushPull, 0 );
00484 
00485 #if defined(PAL_CLOCK_RTCC)
00486     /* Setup RTCC to to toggle PRS or generate interrupts at given frequency. */
00487     rtccSetup(frequency);
00488 #else
00489     /* Setup RTC to to toggle PRS or generate interrupts at given frequency. */
00490     rtcSetup(frequency);
00491 #endif
00492   }
00493 
00494   return status;
00495 }

00498 #ifndef INCLUDE_PAL_GPIO_PIN_AUTO_TOGGLE_HW_ONLY
00499 #if defined(PAL_CLOCK_RTC)
00500 /**************************************************************************/
00505 void RTC_IRQHandler(void)
00506 {
00507   /* Clear interrupt source */
00508   RTC_IntClear(RTC_IF_COMP0);
00509 
00510   /* Toggle GPIO pin. */
00511   GPIO_PinOutToggle((GPIO_Port_TypeDef)gpioPortNo, gpioPinNo );
00512 }
00513 #endif /* PAL_CLOCK_RTC */
00514 
00515 #if defined(PAL_CLOCK_RTCC)
00516 /**************************************************************************/
00521 void RTCC_IRQHandler(void)
00522 {
00523   /* Clear interrupt source */
00524   RTCC_IntClear(RTCC_IF_CC1);
00525 
00526   /* Toggle GPIO pin. */
00527   GPIO_PinOutToggle((GPIO_Port_TypeDef)gpioPortNo, gpioPinNo );
00528 }
00529 #endif  /* PAL_CLOCK_RTCC */
00530 #endif  /* INCLUDE_PAL_GPIO_PIN_AUTO_TOGGLE_HW_ONLY */

00533 /**************************************************************************/
00538 static void palClockSetup(CMU_Clock_TypeDef clock)
00539 {
00540   /* Enable LE domain registers */
00541   CMU_ClockEnable(cmuClock_CORELE, true);
00542 
00543 #if ( defined(PAL_CLOCK_RTC) && defined(PAL_RTC_CLOCK_LFXO) ) \
00544     || ( defined(PAL_CLOCK_RTCC) && defined(PAL_RTCC_CLOCK_LFXO) )
00545   /* LFA with LFXO setup is relatively time consuming. Therefore, check if it
00546      already enabled before calling. */
00547   if ( !(CMU->STATUS & CMU_STATUS_LFXOENS) )
00548   {
00549     CMU_OscillatorEnable(cmuOsc_LFXO, true, true);
00550   }
00551   if ( cmuSelect_LFXO != CMU_ClockSelectGet(clock) )
00552   {
00553     CMU_ClockSelectSet(clock, cmuSelect_LFXO);
00554   }
00555 #elif ( defined(PAL_CLOCK_RTC) && defined(PAL_RTC_CLOCK_LFRCO) ) \
00556     || ( defined(PAL_CLOCK_RTCC) && defined(PAL_RTCC_CLOCK_LFRCO) )
00557   /* Enable LF(A|E)CLK in CMU (will also enable LFRCO oscillator if not enabled) */
00558   CMU_ClockSelectSet(clock, cmuSelect_LFRCO);
00559 #elif ( defined(PAL_CLOCK_RTC) && defined(PAL_RTC_CLOCK_ULFRCO) ) \
00560     || ( defined(PAL_CLOCK_RTCC) && defined(PAL_RTCC_CLOCK_ULFRCO) )
00561   /* Enable LF(A|E)CLK in CMU (will also enable ULFRCO oscillator if not enabled) */
00562   CMU_ClockSelectSet(clock, cmuSelect_ULFRCO);
00563 #else
00564 #error No clock source for RTC defined.
00565 #endif
00566 }
00567 
00568 
00569 #if defined(PAL_CLOCK_RTC)
00570 /**************************************************************************/
00574 static void rtcSetup(unsigned int frequency)
00575 {
00576   RTC_Init_TypeDef rtcInit = RTC_INIT_DEFAULT;
00577 
00578   palClockSetup(cmuClock_LFA);
00579 
00580   /* Set the prescaler. */
00581   CMU_ClockDivSet( cmuClock_RTC, cmuClkDiv_2 );
00582   
00583   /* Enable RTC clock */
00584   CMU_ClockEnable(cmuClock_RTC, true);
00585 
00586   /* Initialize RTC */
00587   rtcInit.enable   = false;  /* Do not start RTC after initialization is complete. */
00588   rtcInit.debugRun = false;  /* Halt RTC when debugging. */
00589   rtcInit.comp0Top = true;   /* Wrap around on COMP0 match. */
00590 
00591   RTC_Init(&rtcInit);
00592 
00593   /* Interrupt at given frequency. */
00594   RTC_CompareSet(0, ((CMU_ClockFreqGet(cmuClock_RTC) / frequency) - 1) & _RTC_COMP0_MASK );
00595 
00596 #ifndef INCLUDE_PAL_GPIO_PIN_AUTO_TOGGLE_HW_ONLY
00597   /* Enable interrupt */
00598   NVIC_EnableIRQ(RTC_IRQn);
00599   RTC_IntEnable(RTC_IEN_COMP0);
00600 #endif
00601   RTC_CounterReset();
00602   /* Start Counter */
00603   RTC_Enable(true);
00604 }
00605 #endif /* PAL_CLOCK_RTC */
00606 
00607 
00608 #if defined(PAL_CLOCK_RTCC)
00609 /**************************************************************************/
00613 static void rtccSetup(unsigned int frequency)
00614 {
00615   RTCC_Init_TypeDef rtccInit = RTCC_INIT_DEFAULT;
00616   rtccInit.presc = rtccCntPresc_1;
00617 
00618   palClockSetup(cmuClock_LFE);
00619   /* Enable RTCC clock */
00620   CMU_ClockEnable(cmuClock_RTCC, true);
00621 
00622   /* Initialize RTC */
00623   rtccInit.enable   = false;  /* Do not start RTC after initialization is complete. */
00624   rtccInit.debugRun = false;  /* Halt RTC when debugging. */
00625   rtccInit.cntWrapOnCCV1 = true;   /* Wrap around on CCV1 match. */
00626   RTCC_Init(&rtccInit);
00627 
00628   /* Interrupt at given frequency. */
00629   RTCC_CCChConf_TypeDef ccchConf = RTCC_CH_INIT_COMPARE_DEFAULT;
00630   ccchConf.compMatchOutAction = rtccCompMatchOutActionToggle;
00631   RTCC_ChannelInit(1, &ccchConf);
00632   RTCC_ChannelCCVSet(1, (CMU_ClockFreqGet(cmuClock_RTCC) / frequency) - 1);
00633 
00634 #ifndef INCLUDE_PAL_GPIO_PIN_AUTO_TOGGLE_HW_ONLY
00635   /* Enable interrupt */
00636   NVIC_EnableIRQ(RTCC_IRQn);
00637   RTCC_IntEnable(RTCC_IEN_CC1);
00638 #endif
00639 
00640   RTCC->CNT = _RTCC_CNT_RESETVALUE;
00641   /* Start Counter */
00642   RTCC_Enable(true);
00643 }
00644 #endif  /* PAL_CLOCK_RTCC */
00645 #endif  /* INCLUDE_PAL_GPIO_PIN_AUTO_TOGGLE */
